item.title: Neovim The Lightweight pseudo-IDE champion
item.description: One to edit all A large portion of a programmer’s everyday work is to manipulate text and knowing to do this effortlessly can enhance his/her efficiency at coding. The best way, in my opinion, to be proficient with an editor is to pick one, which ever one you want, and use it every day to edit just anything, tweak it a little from time to time, cut down the number of keystrokes you need to type for a specific task and in general stick with it.
